intro: Silene anomala, commonly known as the redstem sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, and it is often found in open habitats such as dunes or disturbed areas. Silene anomala is a perennial herb that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds.
